qas.question: When did Henry VIII take direct royal control?
Who gave the abbey status of a cathedral in 1540?
What did the cathedral status save the abbey from?
What did changing the status of the abbey create?
When did Henry VII take direct royal control?
When did Henry VIII take indirect royal control?
Who gave the abbey status of a cathedral in 1504?
What did the cathedral status not save the abbey from?

context: <a1_0><b6_0>Henry VIII<b6_0/><a1_0/> assumed direct royal control in <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>1539<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> and granted the abbey the status of a cathedral by charter in 1540, simultaneously issuing letters patent establishing <a3_0>the Diocese of Westminster<a3_0/>. By granting the abbey cathedral status Henry VIII gained an excuse to spare it from the <a2_0><b7_0>destruction<b7_0/><a2_0/> or dissolution which he inflicted on most English abbeys during this period.
